overview: In this cinematic love letter to Jacques Tati and the early Dadaist influenced work of Rene Clair, a mischievous red telephone kiosk lures our gentleman hero Mr Beardy into its tiny interior and engages him in a surrealist game involving a talking book, a smiling llama, Neville Chamberlain and British dance music of the 1920s.
title: Mr Beardy Answers the Phone
